name: Go
premise: Two players compete to control the most territory on the game board.
description: Go is a two-player game where the aim is to surround more territory than your opponent, a game of strategy that originated in China more than 2,500 years ago.
session_playtime_notes: Game duration can vary greatly depending on the players' level of skill and the size of the game board.
immersiveness_level_notes: The strategic depth and simplicity of the rules can create a highly engaging experience.
learning_curve_notes: The rules are simple, but the game has deep strategic complexity.
save_mechanism_notes: Games are usually played in one session.
how_to_win: Control more territory on the board than your opponent.
how_to_lose: Having less territory than your opponent at the end of the game.

reasons: Go is a deeply strategic game with simple rules but complex gameplay.

unique_selling_point: Go's depth of strategy and simplicity of rules have allowed it to remain popular for thousands of years.
